hedline.hl1: Survey Finds Most in City Give CUNY High Rating

abstract.p: Quinnipiac College Polling Institute survey finds that despite sharp criticism of City University of New York by Mayor Rudolph W Giuliani and some of CUNY's own trustees, majority of city's voters rate university highly (S)

block.p: Despite sharp criticism of the City University of New York by Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani and some of CUNY's own trustees, a majority of the city's voters rate the university highly and say they would recommend it to a friend or relative, according to a survey released yesterday by the Quinnipiac College Polling Institute.

The poll, taken last week, found that 68 percent of the 759 New York City taxpayers answering the survey rated CUNY as a ''very good'' or ''fairly good'' educational institution. Eleven percent called it ''fairly bad'' or ''very bad.''

Despite sharp criticism of the City University of New York by Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani and some of CUNY's own trustees, a majority of the city's voters rate the university highly and say they would recommend it to a friend or relative, according to a survey released yesterday by the Quinnipiac College Polling Institute.

The poll, taken last week, found that 68 percent of the 759 New York City taxpayers answering the survey rated CUNY as a ''very good'' or ''fairly good'' educational institution. Eleven percent called it ''fairly bad'' or ''very bad.''
In addition, 55 percent of the respondents said they would recommend the City University; 28 percent said they would not.
The poll was conducted between July 29 and Aug. 3 and had a margin of sampling error of plus or minus 3.6 percentage points.
